title: @RiotRepertoir, can we do something about TALON?
body:
I know Talon is probably one of the least topics the balance team likes to talk about. But can we for the love of god fix his bugs?

* His [Q] range after the rework is supposed to be 550, but in game it's 450 and that's a huge {nerf} to his role as an assassin with {reliable gap-closer}.

* His short-ranged [crit-Q] applies in a longer range than it's supposed to be {it's supposed to crit at 170 range, but it applies at 180-190}, so the hope of chasing an enemy is lost many times.

* His [E] has been bugged since his Rework release, it backflips him when used on certain terrains, and this patch specifically the [E] jump is getting more buggy even when using it properly.  

The latter are the bugs that impact in-game experience and sometimes loses you a trade or a team-fight, and you know how critical one should be this season in order to win the game, such out of hand mistakes gives huge disadvantages for you and the team, which results in a higher chance for you to lose the game.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Since I've listed the bugs that make Talon feel awkward and harder to play, he still has few problems that if fixed would make his gameplay experience much more fun and reliable as assassin.
 
* Revert/rework his [W]. his old Rake [W]  had a 2 seconds slow that applied on both parts of the ability, was faster and wider, the new one is longer but easily dodged, is narrower which makes it easier to dodge, and applies a 1 second slow only on the returning blade + it deals more damage on the second part.   why don't we give him the slow on the first part of the [W]?

* Talon can't cast [Q] and [W] mid-air [E], but can cast [R] and when it's done it sends him in a backward motion even when you're about to land.   I would like to know why cant he cast at least his [Q] while jumping ? it makes absolute sense for him to be able to use it, doesnt he jump with the [Q] to begin with? 

* Give him an additional 50 range on his [Q] to be 600 range.

* and his major problem is not the damage, but where it all lies.  You've given him a rework that's supposed to be fun to play, but put most of his damage in his passive, and AGAIN, it's an Auto-attack reliant passive. You gave him raw damage, nothing more, not % hp damage, not even grievous wounds on his bleed.

You wanted Talon to become a single target assassin, but he used to be that with his old [E] damage amplifier. now he lost the [15% damage amplifier], and a lot of damage in his [W] and [Q, used to fully crit], and all was shifted to his new passive.


If you feel like fixing his bugs + giving hims some QoL buffs would make him overpowered, then he should definitely be reverted like Rengar and Leblanc.

replies.body: Hi. I'm running around between meetings and various other commitments atm so I can't gives this a ton of engagement right now, but it sounds like we're going to increase his Q range, which I guess got bugged several patches ago to be shorter than intended somehow.

Be careful when choosing the increase.  Talon already has over a 52% winrate: giving him another buff could easily make him overpowered.

Setting his Q range to the 550 he was promised may not sound like much, but it would be huge because that’s almost every mage’s basic attack range.  Right now, he must land his rake or step forward into danger to threaten an all-in during early laning.  With a Q range of 550, he could do so by standing on a minion that any mage were about to last-hit with a basic attack.  The big MR buff he recently received would only enable this zoning playstyle further.

Also, although mages can last-hit with their poke spells, doing so would drain their mana and hinder their ability to pressure Talon with poke or waveclear.  Talon would meanwhile be free to poke, last-hit, or push with Rake.  A Q range of 525 or less, on the other hand, would give his opponents some breathing room.  Does this sound fair?

Holy shit a rioter commented about talon it's been a while. Talon has a bug with his e where it will flip you in a completely wrong direction. I don't think that's a bug (At least not with the examples I've seen of turrets) but due to how the ability works.
You try to jump one direction, the game instead makes you go a different direction. How can you possibly justify that as "not a bug"?

Don't quote me on this or anything, but IIRC the bug has more to do with how pathing works in this game instead of E itself.

So yeah, if we're gonna be *super* nitpicky about it, it actually isn't a bug technically speaking, given how Riot has said they can't really do anything big to fix pathing.

You ignore normal pathing when using e (it counts as a movement command that ignores untapped terrain), so even if it was a terrain pathing issue that would still be a bug because Talon's e is supposed to completely ignore terrain pathing.

I have spent a fairly large amount of time trying to replicate this bug and the only thing I can plausibly put the blame on is the hit boxes for his e. They are terribly drawn and it looks like Talon frequently can actually get inside the hit box, thus causing the direction of the e to become completely random.

Edit: As I was just double checking this I actually found a new location this happens at.

https://i.gyazo.com/3979269736ba1d56464a77a31fcd1e44.png

Arrow shows the path I was running, X being where I was clicking. As you can see I can actually get much closer to the wall then the red outline would suggest, I'm fairly certain that is why I landed slightly north of my initial e cast instead of jumping over the wall.
Because how his E works might be based more on geometry rather than angle. It depends on how it determines how it goes over terrain.

> It depends on how it determines how it goes over terrain.

You go from point A to point B unless that distance is too far, at which point you travel to point C instead which is the closest area to point B that is within range. The bug in question can literally make you go from point A to point A while also putting the wall on cd, there is no argument for that not being a bug.

Repertoir, as a challenger talon otp, I just want to mention: Talon's already in a very good spot right now. Across euw, na, and kr, there are 3 challenger talon top players and 1 talon mid player. While I strongly agree that the q range bugs (both ranged and melee) along with the backflip bug should be fixed, please be very careful not to over-buff him. Due to the nature of his kit, Talon is one of the hardest macro champs to play in the game - to the point where even dedicated one tricks will often play him very sub-optimally. If he is buffed to the point where sub optimal becomes strong, then he will be completely broken in the hands of more competent players.

Further, please keep in mind that Talon's high e mobility should be balanced out with a slightly lower q range, making the low q range not as weak as people may believe. An example: If a good Talon player wants to engage on an enemy laner, he will simply walk out of lane and e back in to close the gap. A bad Talon player will attempt to walk up to q, getting kited and poked out. Low q range rewards good Talon players and punishes the bad players.

Hey, nice to see a rioter responding to a thread about talon. I'm not gonna ask you for buffs or anything like that, but could you please look into all of the bugs that have been in talon's kit since the rework a year ago. Bugs like:

-  his q range being shorter than intended. 
-  his e backfiring and causing you to back-flip randomly when targeting a wall or turret.
- his melee q not properly resetting his auto-attack animation and locking talon in place while unable to auto attack for a whole 1.5 seconds (this usually happens to me when killing jungle camps)
- his melee q often is activating outside the indicated range when chasing an enemy, resulting in the loss of the q dash mechanic.

I currently play almost solely talon at low diamond elo and I genuinely think that fixing these bugs would go a long way towards making the champ more enjoyable for players at all levels.
